### Ingest data 


```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

df <- read.csv('archetypes/how-happy-are-we/how-happy-are-we.csv', encoding = "UTF-8")
df


```


### Wrangle data


```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}
 
# Select and rename columns
 df1  <- df[,1:10]%>% 
   rename(Social.support = Explained.by..Social.support, 
                    GDP.capita=Explained.by..Log.GDP.per.capita
         ,Life.expectancy = Explained.by..Healthy.life.expectancy
         ,Freedom= Explained.by..Freedom.to.make.life.choices
         ,Generosity=Explained.by..Generosity
         ,Corruption=Explained.by..Perceptions.of.corruption
         ,Country=X.U.FEFF.Country.name
         ,Region=Regional.indicator)

```


### Plot Beeswarm


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width = 1920/72, fig.height = 1080/72, out.width = "100%"}

theme_opts <- theme(
    text = element_text(family = "inconsolata"), 
    plot.title = element_text(color = "#E36857", size = 20, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "#ff9a55", size = 9, face = "bold"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "#4392C0", size = 10, face = "bold"),
    axis.title.x = element_blank(),
    axis.title.y = element_text(color = "#4392C0", size=12,face="bold"),
    # panel.border = element_blank(),
    # panel.background = element_blank(),
    # panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), # remove minor gridlines
    legend.position = "none")

v1 <- ggplot(data = df1, aes(x= factor(Region, levels=c(
                 "Sub-Saharan Africa","South Asia","Middle East and North Africa",
                 "Commonwealth of Independent States","Southeast Asia","East Asia",
                 "Central & Eastern Europe","Latin America and Caribbean","Western Europe",
                 "North America and ANZ")),
                 y = Avg.Ladder.Score, color = Region)) +
  geom_beeswarm(cex = 1.5, priority = "density", size = 5)+
  labs(title="How Happy Are We?",
        y = "Happiness Score")+ 
  scale_x_discrete(breaks= c(
                 "Sub-Saharan Africa","South Asia","Middle East and North Africa",
                 "Commonwealth of Independent States","Southeast Asia","East Asia",
                 "Central & Eastern Europe","Latin America and Caribbean","Western Europe",
                 "North America and ANZ"), 
    labels=c(    "Sub-Saharan\nAfrica","South Asia","Middle East\n&  North Africa",
                 "Commonwealth of\nIndependent States","Southeast Asia","East Asia",
                 "Central &\nEastern Europe","Latin America &\nCaribbean","Western Europe",
                 "North America &\nANZ"))+
  theme_bw()+
  theme_opts
  

girafe(ggobj = v1, width_svg = 1280/72, height_svg = 720/72,
       options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0)))




```



### Transform data for second plot

```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# Transform wide to long
# Group by region and calculate the average of value for each measure/category
df2 <- df1 %>%
  gather(measure,value,
         Social.support, 
         GDP.capita,
         Life.expectancy,
         Freedom,
         Generosity,
         Corruption)%>%
  dplyr::select(measure,value, Country,Region)%>%
  group_by(Region,measure)%>%
  summarise(avg=sum(value)) 

# Create a list to change the facet order
x_position = c("Social.support", "GDP.capita", "Life.expectancy", "Freedom","Generosity","Corruption")

df2

```

### Augmenting the Bee Swarm Plot

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE}

v2 <- ggplot( transform(df2, 
                  Region=factor(Region, 
                  levels=c(
                    "Sub-Saharan Africa","South Asia",
                    "Middle East and North Africa",
                    "Commonwealth of Independent States",
                    "Southeast Asia","East Asia",
                    "Central & Eastern Europe",
                    "Latin America and Caribbean",
                    "Western Europe",
                    "North America and ANZ"))),
                    aes( x = measure, y = avg ,fill=Region) ) + 
      geom_bar( stat = "identity" ) + 
      facet_wrap( ~ Region, scales = "free_x", ncol=10 ) + 
      scale_x_discrete(limits = rev(x_position))+
      coord_flip() +
       
      theme(
      plot.title = element_blank(),
      axis.title.y = element_blank(),
      axis.title.x = element_blank(),
      axis.text.x = element_blank(),
      axis.ticks = element_blank(),
      strip.text.x = element_blank(),
      axis.text.y = element_text(size=6),
      legend.position = "none")



```



```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width = 1920/72, fig.height = 1080/72, out.width = "100%"}


v3 <- ggarrange(v1, v2, ncol=1, nrow=2, heights = c(1,0.3))

girafe(ggobj = v3, width_svg = 1280/72, height_svg = 720/72,
       options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0)))

```



```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, class.source='fold-show'}

# eval = FALSE as default; run manually as chunk

# full version
ggsave(filename = "assets/happiness-index.svg", plot = ggarrange(v1, v2, ncol=1, nrow=2, heights = c(1,0.3)), width=1280/72, height=720/72)

```
